intro: Elyna sibirica, commonly known as Siberian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and northern Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. The plant produces striking blue to violet flowers in late summer, which bloom in clusters at the top of the stems. Elyna sibirica thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler regions.
